Original question: How does \psi(x,t) evolve in time given \psi(x,0) = sqrt(1/6)*\phi_0(x) + sqrt(1/3)*\phi_1(x) + sqrt(1/2)*\phi_2(x) where \phi_i(x) are the i^th eigenstates of a 1D infinite square well that spans for x=0 to x=L
Solution: \psi(x,t) = e^(-i E_0 t / \hbar) * sqrt(1/6)*\phi_0(x) + e^(-i E_1 t / \hbar) * sqrt(1/3)*\phi_1(x) + e^(-i E_2 t / \hbar) * sqrt(1/2)*\phi_2(x)
